CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 16, 1949, pg. 3 reads: "Would-Be Policeman - Whit Gallman Jr., 3059 Centre Avenue, scored ninety-six in official examination given recently for city policemen. Mr. Gallman's score, plus the 10 per cent given to war veterans, shoves him over the top with a total of 106 points.  Mr. Gallman is a veteran of three years' service with the U.S. Marine Corps in the Asiatic-Pacific Theatre. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Whit Gallman Jr., wearing moustache, double breasted suit, and geometric patterned tie, posed in Harris Studio
